metadata.title: SF DBI Electronic Plan Review (EPR) Requirements
notes: DBI transitioned to 100% electronic plan review (EPR) effective January 1, 2024
Detailed technical specifications are operational procedures, not fully codified in published regulations
AB-004 mandates EPR for priority projects; in practice EPR is now required for ALL projects
Bluebeam Studio is the submission platform per DBI operational procedures
Specific format requirements below are compiled from info sheet references and DBI practice — verify with DBI for current requirements
gaps: No published regulatory document specifies complete PDF format requirements
Bluebeam Studio specifications are operational, not codified in Administrative Bulletins
Maximum file size limits are DBI-set, may change without regulatory amendment
Sheet size requirements referenced in completeness checklist but exact EPR specs may differ

epr_mandate.regulatory_basis: Administrative Bulletin AB-004, Section on Concurrent Review
epr_mandate.quote: The applicant of a priority project shall be required to submit plans for electronic plan review (EPR) to avail of concurrent plan review.
epr_mandate.current_status: As of January 1, 2024, ALL plan submissions to DBI must be electronic — EPR is no longer limited to priority projects

submission_platform.name: Bluebeam Studio
submission_platform.note: Platform details are operational — confirm current submission process with DBI

format_requirements.confidence: medium — compiled from multiple sources, not a single authoritative document

requirements.details: All construction plans must be submitted as PDF files
PDF should be created from CAD/BIM software, not scanned images. Scanned PDFs may be rejected or cause review delays.
PDFs must not have security restrictions that prevent markup, commenting, or printing
requirements.source: DBI operational practice for Bluebeam compatibility

requirements.details: All fonts must be embedded in the PDF to ensure correct rendering across systems
PDF must contain bookmarks corresponding to each sheet for navigation during plan review
requirements.source: DBI operational practice for Bluebeam Studio

requirements.details: Plans must be at minimum 11x17 inches per completeness checklist; full plan sets typically 22x34 inches or 24x36 inches
All plan sets must include a Back Check page for reviewer corrections tracking

pre_submission_checks: No security restrictions on PDF file
Proper layering (demolition, new work, existing to remain)
Title block with permit application number on each sheet
Prepared by licensed architect or engineer (stamp and signature)
Green Building form (GS1-GS6) attached as applicable

submission_copies.otc_review: Submit via PermitSF portal — electronic only as of Jan 2024
submission_copies.in_house_review: Submit via PermitSF portal for electronic plan review
submission_copies.note: Physical paper plans are no longer accepted for initial submission

cover_sheet: Project scope description matching permit application
Code references (Building Code edition, Fire Code, Accessibility)
architectural_plans: Sections showing existing and proposed conditions

decision_tree_integration.step_5_connection: EPR format requirements apply to ALL documents listed in decision tree Step 5
decision_tree_integration.otc_implications: Some OTC 'no plans' permits (Form 8) do not require plan drawings but still use electronic submission
decision_tree_integration.in_house_implications: In-house review plans must be EPR-formatted for multi-agency concurrent review routing
